alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 29 at 3:43PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Warmer temperatures last week increased mountain snowmelt, resulting in significant rises on area streams. The addition of significant precipitation through Tuesday will add more runoff to these waterways. While flooding is not anticipated on larger rivers and streams, there is a chance that some smaller streams and creeks could reach bankfull in the foothills, producing localized flooding. Any flooding will depend on how heavy the precipitation is that falls on that stream basin. At the very least stream flows will be much higher with the increased snowmelt and precipitation generated runoff. For those living near waterways, be prepared for higher water levels. Move any livestock and equipment to higher ground away from waterways. For those planning recreation activities on or near waterways, be prepared for changing conditions and significantly higher flows. Fast flowing muddy water can conceal hazards making floating dangerous until runoff abates. Erosion will also increase as stream flows increase, making stream banks unstable. Be sure to stay well away from the edge as undercut stream banks can give way suddenly. Do not allow children to play near the edge of fast flowing streams. Every year children are accidentally swept away during runoff season, don`t let it happen to your children. Stay tuned to the forecast. Please report any flooding to local law enforcement and have them relay the report to the National Weather Service.
